name: NSSortDescriptor
desc: An immutable description of how to order a collection of objects according to a property common to all the objects.

items.name: init(key: String?, ascending: Bool)
items.desc: Creates a sort descriptor with a specified string key path and sort order.

items.name: init(key: String?, ascending: Bool, selector: Selector?)
items.desc: Creates a sort descriptor with a specified string key path, ordering, and comparison selector.

items.name: init<Root, Value>(keyPath: KeyPath<Root, Value>, ascending: Bool)
items.desc: Creates a sort descriptor with a specified key path and ordering.

items.name: init(key: String?, ascending: Bool, comparator: Comparator)
items.desc: Creates a sort descriptor with a specified string key path and ordering, and a comparator block.

items.name: init<Root, Value>(keyPath: KeyPath<Root, Value>, ascending: Bool, comparator: Comparator)
items.desc: Creates a sort descriptor with a specified key path and ordering, and a comparator block.

items.name: init?(coder: NSCoder)
items.desc: Creates a sort descriptor by decoding from the coder you specify.

items.name: init<Compared>(SortDescriptor<Compared>)
items.desc: Creates a sort descriptor using a sort descriptor you specify.

items.name: var ascending: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver specifies sorting in ascending order.

items.name: var key: String?
items.desc: The key that specifies the property to compare during sorting.

items.name: var keyPath: AnyKeyPath?
items.desc: The key path that specifies the property to compare during sorting.

items.name: var comparator: Comparator
items.desc: The comparator for the sort descriptor.

items.name: func compare(Any, to: Any) -> ComparisonResult
items.desc: Returns a comparison result value that indicates the sort order of two objects.

items.name: var reversedSortDescriptor: Any
items.desc: Returns a sort descriptor that reverses the sort order.

items.name: func allowEvaluation()
items.desc: Forces a securely decoded sort descriptor to allow evaluation.
